title: Cast a Spell
subtitle: Cast time of 1 reaction
description: Cast a spell with a casting time of 1 reaction.
bullets: Trigger: As specified by the spell's description.
Examples: Shield triggers when you are hit by an attack, Counterspell triggers when you see a creature casting a spell, and Feather Fall triggers when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls.

title: Opportunity Attack
subtitle: Enemy leaves your reach
description: You can make an attack against a foe that drops its guard. This is the most common reaction in combat.
bullets: Trigger: A hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach.
Reaction: You use your reaction to make one melee attack against the provoking creature.
The attack occurs right before the creature leaves your reach.
You don't provoke an opportunity attack when you teleport or when someone or something moves you without using your movement, action, or reaction.
The Disengage action prevents you from provoking opportunity attacks for the rest of your turn.

title: Readied Action
subtitle: Part of your Ready action
description: Execute the reaction specified by your Ready action.
bullets: Trigger: The perceivable circumstance you defined when you took the Ready action on your turn.
Reaction: You perform the action or move you chose to ready. This occurs immediately after the trigger finishes.
If you ready a spell, you cast it on your turn but use your reaction to release it. This requires concentration, which can be broken.

title: Identify a Spell*
subtitle: Identify a spell being cast
description: Use your knowledge of the arcane to identify a spell as it is being cast.
bullets: (Optional Rule â€“ XGE):
Trigger: A creature you can see casts a spell.
Reaction: Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check. The DC equals 15 + the spell's level.
On a success, you identify the spell. This allows you to decide whether to use Counterspell effectively.
This check does not reveal the level of the spell slot used.
This can also be an action on your turn to identify an ongoing magical effect.

title: Parry*
subtitle: Defend against a melee attack
description: Add a bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you. This is a common homebrew rule adapted from NPC abilities for player use.
reference: Based on abilities in MM, pgs. 346-348.
bullets: (DM Adaptation / Homebrew):
Trigger: Another creature hits you with a melee attack.
Reaction: You must be able to see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
You add a bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing it to miss. (The bonus is often your proficiency bonus for PCs).
This rule is based on the Parry reaction available to NPCs like the Guard, Noble, and Gladiator.

title: Grapple **
subtitle: Stop an enemy from fleeing
description: A house rule allowing a creature to use a Grapple in place of the normal damage-dealing Opportunity Attack.
bullets: (Uncommon Homebrew Rule):
Trigger: A hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach.
By standard rules (RAW), an Opportunity Attack is 'one melee attack,' not the 'Attack action,' so you cannot replace it with a grapple or shove.
This house rule allows you to make a special grapple check instead of a damage roll, potentially stopping the creature in its tracks by grappling it (reducing its speed to 0).

title: Shove Opportunity Attack **
subtitle: Stop an enemy from fleeing
description: A house rule allowing a creature to use a Shove in place of the normal damage-dealing Opportunity Attack.
bullets: (Uncommon Homebrew Rule):
Trigger: A hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach.
By standard rules (RAW), an Opportunity Attack is 'one melee attack,' not the 'Attack action,' so you cannot replace it with a grapple or shove.
This house rule allows you to make a special shove check instead of a damage roll, potentially stopping the creature in its tracks by grappling it (reducing its speed to 0).

title: Dive for Cover **
subtitle: Dodge an area effect
description: A house rule that allows a creature to use their reaction to avoid area-of-effect damage.
bullets: (Rare Homebrew Rule):
Trigger: You are subjected to an effect that requires you to make a Dexterity saving throw (like a Fireball or a dragon's breath).
Reaction: You can use your reaction to dive for cover.
Effect: You gain advantage on the Dexterity saving throw. If you succeed on the save, you may also move up to 5 feet to the nearest unoccupied space and fall prone.
